website_summaries.verdict: A masterfully formulated and proven CVT fluid for Nissan and Infiniti vehicles.
pros: Consists of a unique formulation of advanced friction modifiers and additives to ensure stable, precise operation
Provides superb low-temperature fluidity for smooth shifting
Maintains proper pressure in hot weather
cons: Tends to be more expensive than other CVT fluids

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: Necessary stuff for the CVT transmission of a 2011 Nissan Sentra. Have 93k miles on my car (bought it at 75k), and the car had a whining noise that changed based on engine speed a few months after buying it. Did a fluid change (not a flush), drained about 4 quarts, replaced the missing fluids, and now the car runs better than when I bought it. I'd recommend anyone who has a Nissan CVT (and it's not sealed) to change their fluid every 60-75k or so (service manual recommends it)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Andres

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff. Remember If you have high mileage do ...
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. Remember If you have high mileage do NOT do a flush, just drain and add about 5 quarts of this. Flushing can ruin the buildup that has happened over time and your transmission will slip and be even worse than it is now. I did a drain and fill 2007 altima cvt automatic and it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Fraser

customer_reviews.title: Good Nissan branded fluid.
customer_reviews.text: Expensive, but necessary fluid. Good Nissan branded ns2 fluid. Not sure what to say about this other than to only use Nissan branded NS2 fluid, do not use aftermarket fluids. Lastly, change your fluid every 30k miles (dump and fill)
customer_reviews.author: trssho91

customer_reviews.title: Use Genuine Nissan NS-2 CVT Fluid
customer_reviews.text: A little pricy but needed for maintaining the 120K CVT warranty on my son's 2010 Sentra SR. Changed the fluid in about an hour and saved about $185.
customer_reviews.author: Dan-O

customer_reviews.title: I only need 5 Q
customer_reviews.text: I bought 6 Q because I read some review online said they use about 5.2-5.3ish Q. Actually only need 5 Q is enough. If ship the extra 1 back it will cost me $7.5 shipping. so maybe just keep it and use it after 3 year for another fluid change. Or flush with 1 Q next time, make it just a little bit cleaner before adding 5 Q.
customer_reviews.author: yuantaochen

customer_reviews.title: Buy it here.
customer_reviews.text: This is the genuine Nissan product which is required by the CVT transmission and it works fine. Changing the transmission fluid is not as easy as it sounds on some vehicles especially when you have no drain plug. In that case you need to use use a siphon tube
customer_reviews.author: CoffeeHolic

customer_reviews.title: Drained and filled 08 Altima. Easy maintenance. A must for the CVT transmission
customer_reviews.text: Best price I could find. Drained and filled my wife's 08 Altima. Bought 6 qts. Had about a half a quart left over. It wasn't acting up just a preventive maintenance issue
customer_reviews.author: Chris McAfee

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware!! No. 2. I bought 5 bottles of this Nissan CVT fluid from amazon. I lifted the car in the morning, drained the car cvt fluids. When I refilled the tranny, I found that two of the five fluids were not cvt fluid, but the ATF fluid. Nissan cars are very specific for its CVT fluids. Those ATF fluids might have ruined my tranny had I not found out the ATF fluid. The bottles are very similar. So Amazon sold me two much cheaper ATF fluid bottles as the CVT fluids, and it wasted my whole day since the car was not drivable without the correct CVT fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon buyer

customer_reviews.title: Product shipped quick, and worked perfectly. Wanted to ...
customer_reviews.text: Product shipped quick, and worked perfectly. Wanted to flush out the old fluid. Nissan warranty on CVT tranny says have to use OEM fluids, so with this was able to do at home, and not have to be ripped of by a dealer. Job was extremely simple. Saved myself 100s.

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than the dealer. Works well. No issues. No codes. Is green though. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Amz Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price. So much cheaper than buying it from the dealership.
customer_reviews.author: Jolerie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Genuine fluid for my Altima. Worked perfectly after a CVT drain & refill.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Was a great price and much easier than having to go thru a dealer to purchase. Very pleased with the product and ease.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is so expensive but it's worth buying OEM.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge C.

customer_reviews.title: Transmission Fluid
customer_reviews.text: Bought the OEM fluid at a very good price from this vendor and brought it to a local shop for a drain and fill. This saved me over a $100 from having the dealer do the same job.
customer_reviews.author: James O

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works in my 2007 Murano. I did a drain, not a flush. 5.25 quarts.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Good delivery!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed at my front door! I wish it was cheaper...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This oil is such a great deal it is 20 dollars at the dealer way better deal on Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fixed the issues I was having with my transmission immediately

customer_reviews.title: A genuine Nissan part; cheaper than ordering from a ...
customer_reviews.text: A genuine Nissan part; cheaper than ordering from a dealer and having to pay its 40% markup. Would buy again.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you need a Nissan transmission change the price is right!

customer_reviews.title: Fast and received correct item and amount.
customer_reviews.text: Came early everything was correct with the order. I will be ordering again in the future

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Nissan CVT fluid worked great on my wife's 2007 Sentra
customer_reviews.text: Genuine Nissan CVT fluid worked great on my wife's 2007 Sentra. Dont ever use anything other than OEM fluids in the transmission especialy A CVT. Unsure which fluid look at the dipstick it will tell you on the cap. If not a quick 10 min phone call to the dealers part department will clear that up
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: just what the doctor ordered for my nissan
customer_reviews.text: and she is purring like a kitten with more than 149k
customer_reviews.author: YV_action_007

customer_reviews.title: This is the stuff ... don't use anything but this stuff for your Nissan CVT
customer_reviews.text: Factory fluid and at a bargain price. If you have a Nissan CVT and want it to last ... change at least 6 quarts of fluid every 30,000 miles. ONLY use this factory fluid.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Nissan Sentra 2007
customer_reviews.text: Buy seven quarts not five. Trust me. Just drain your transmission put the drain plug in place and put the seven quarts on it. Do not pay more than $14 per bottle. However, compare to the Dearlership $20 plus per quart this was a Super buy. NS2 CVT transmission fluid. The color is light green. It looks like antifreeze. I was expecting pink or red fluid. O well It work for my Nissan Sentra 2007 with 104,000 miles on it. I spent a lot of time in the highway. Addendumm..12/19/2015 I have 141,000 miles, Still running well with the previous change. Another 20,000 miles and I will be buying another Seven quarts. Hasta Luego.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: I would not use anything else in my 2012 Nissan ...
customer_reviews.text: I would not use anything else in my 2012 Nissan Maxima transmission. I also changed the filter at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie 70

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware! I just received fluids today, the ...
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware! I just received fluids today, the outer packing design is different from advertised. I am not sure if it is old stock or genuine OEM, will definitely return them. Amazon should update the pics ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: phil0311

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I discovered that I needed a quart of Nissan cvt transmission fluid for my nissan rogue. The dealer wants over $20 a quart for this product. Do yourself a favor, and buy from amazon. Save yourself a bunch of money.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: Best deal I have seen. I saved around $10 a quart. I have two maxima's that have the CVT transmission, so I could used the bulk rate.
customer_reviews.author: trurazor
